articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Albania
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Albania
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, on November 28 sent a message of greetings to Sali Berisha, Prime Minister of Albania, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished the friendly Albanian people progress and well-being.

articles.title: Kim Ki Nam Meets Yemeni Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Ki Nam Meets Yemeni Delegation
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the General People's Congress of Yemen led by Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim, member of the General Committee and head of the Political Department of the congress, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.

articles.title: Cooperation between WPK and Yemeni Part
articles.content:
Cooperation between WPK and Yemeni Party
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- An agreement on friendship and cooperation between the Workers' Party of Korea and the General People's Congress of Yemen was signed at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the WPK side were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, and officials concerned and from the opposite side members of the delegation of the General People's Congress of Yemen led by Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim, member of the General Committee and head of the Political Department of the congress.
					
					 The agreement was inked by Kim Ki Nam and Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim.

articles.title: DPRK Soccer Team Beats Japanese Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Soccer Team Beats Japanese Rival
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team beat its Japanese rival 2-1 in the quarterfinals of the 2008 FIFA U-20 Women's World Cup held in Chile on Dec. 1, advancing into the semi-finals.

articles.title: National Day of Romania Observed
articles.content:
National Day of Romania Observed
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A film show was arranged at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps here on Tuesday to mark the national day of Romania.
					 Present at the show were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Ryu Sung Rim, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Romania Friendship Association, officials concerned, working people in the city and Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Iancu Liviu Ovidiu and staff members of the Romanian embassy here.
					
					 The participants appreciated a Romanian feature film.

articles.title: New Puppet Dramas Produced
articles.content:
New Puppet Dramas Produced
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Puppet Show Troupe has recently produced new puppet dramas.
					The puppet shows reflecting the juvenile mind vividly are put on the stage every day, arousing interest among school children.
					
					The short piece "Janggo (a long Korean drum that tapers in the middle) Talent" represents finely the Korean traditional dance of turning round decorative tassels and janggo techniques with light and dynamic rhythm and peculiar skill and thus shows well that best is the tune of the Korean national music.
					
					The short piece "Musical Entertainment of Our Sub-Branch" is based on the theme of preparing a musical entertainment of a sub-branch of the Children's Union. After appreciating it, school children say in unison they came to know well that if they pool strength, they can do anything difficult.
					
					The short piece "Bullfrog and Bell Toad" adapted from a story that a small bullfrog beat back a big snake inculcates in the mind of the audience the truth that people can win the enemy only when they fight bravely against the enemy, not afraid of it.
					
					In an interview with KCNA, Choe Man Gum, a section chief of the Pyongyang Puppet Theatre, said that a lot of school children come and see the puppet drama every day, adding:
					
					While seeing the performance giving the truth and lesson of life, the viewers realize what a true life is and foster the spirit of loving justice.
					
					We will make every effort to create more works good for raising the school children as reliable pillars of the country in the future, too.

articles.title: U.S. Projected New Combined Operations Rapped
articles.content:
U.S. Projected New Combined Operations Rapped
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. "security experts" underscored the "need" for U.S.-Japan combined operations. This serves as a dangerous signal for finally examining and rounding off the preparations for starting another Korean war.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. imperialists have completed all preparations for carrying out their scenario for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK as evidenced by the deployment of huge forces in south Korea and in its vicinity under the simulated conditions of "contingency" on the Korean Peninsula, etc.
					
					 What remains to be done is only an operational matter of how to make a preemptive strike at the DPRK and when and under what pretext. Herein lies the U.S. purpose of building the above-said operational system.
					
					 By the recent "U.S.-Japan alliance in the new era" the U.S. imperialists mean the U.S.-Japan military alliance for provoking the Korean war in the 21st century and by a "timely counter-action" they mean a war of aggression against the DPRK which they may start any time. "A consultation about the military scenario" touted by them is nothing but a U.S.-Japan joint military operational plan for igniting another Korean war. It is the ulterior aim of the U.S. to use Japan as a shock force in the war, retaining its grip on Japan as the most important stronghold for carrying out its strategy for a preemptive attack on the DPRK, readjust and tighten the U.S.-Japan military alliance and the U.S.-south Korea military alliance to keep pace with the projected conclusion of a new military agreement between south Korea and Japan and make them serve the purpose of the above-said Korean war.
					
					 It is the unshakable stand of the DPRK to counter the "preemptive attack", which the U.S. singled out as its main mode of striking the DPRK, through a more powerful advanced preemptive attack of Korean style.
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity, we would like to serve a strong warning to the Japanese reactionaries. The desperate efforts made by Japan to start a reckless war against the DPRK, crying out for "closer alliance" with the U.S. in a bid to get something are as foolish a bid as jumping into the fire with fagots on its back. Japan would be well advised to bear this in mind.
					
					 Should the U.S. persistently come in preemptive attack on the DPRK in collusion with Japan, the army and people of the DPRK will deal a thousand-fold retaliatory blow at the aggressors by use of the powerful war means of Songun and thus inflict a bitter defeat upon them.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppets' Wild Ambition to Invade DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppets' Wild Ambition to Invade DPRK Slammed
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppets are contemplating revising the "national defence reform for 2020" as a dangerous plan for arms buildup, while spreading rumor of "threat from the north." This is prompted by their bellicose scenario to realize at any cost their wild ambition to invade the north in collusion with foreign forces by attaining their goal for beefing up the ultra-modern armed forces earlier than scheduled and pushing ahead with it under a more carefully worked out plan. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The "threat from the north" touted by the puppets is nothing but sheer sophism intended to justify their moves to start a war of aggression against the north and escalate them as it is a replica of "threat of southward invasion" cited by the south Korean successive warmongers. 
					
					 After bringing to light the intention to invade the north, crying out for the provocative "theory of principal enemy" and "preemptive attack" the Lee Myung Bak group of warmongers is getting evermore desperate in its moves to bring the inter-Korean relations to the crisis of total severance and ignite a new war at any cost. 
					
					 The catastrophic crisis of the inter-Korean relations bears a close resemblance to the situation on the eve of a war.
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the Lee regime is making its provocation of a war of aggression against the north an established fact and its adventurous scenario is being put into practice with increased zeal. 
					
					 The puppets are, however, seriously mistaken. It is, indeed, foolish of the puppet warmongers to try to do harm to the DPRK which has demonstrated the might of a military power well known to the world under the banner of Songun. These futile moves of the provocateurs will only precipitate their self-destruction.
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to stop the reckless arms buildup at once, mindful that the provocative acts will only further bedevil the inter-Korean relations and entail disastrous consequences.

articles.title: Abolition of NSL in S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
Abolition of NSL in S. Korea Demanded
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- To abrogate the "National Security Law", a vicious anti-reunification fascist law in south Korea, is the demand of the times and the unanimous will of the entire Korean nation, says Rodong Sinmun today in a by-lined article.
					 The article notes that the successive traitorous rulers of south Korea have used the NSL as a tool to maintain the U.S. colonial rule and their fascist dictatorial system and check national reconciliation, unity and reunification, committing hideous crimes before the country and the nation for six decades.
					
					 The NSL, cooked up under the pretext of "national security" on December 1, 1948, is the worst evil law ever in history and it has turned into the peerlessly fascist law through continued retrogressive revision over the last decades, the article points out, and says:
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group is rashly invoking the notorious NSL as a means for "ruling security" and anti-reunification confrontation as the preceding dictators did. Due to such fascist deeds, democracy and human rights are now being seriously violated and the past era of terrible dictatorship is coming back to south Korea.
					
					 The NSL defines fellow countrymen as "enemies" and incriminates contact and exchange between the people and personages of all strata in the north and the south while serving for harsh suppression of the progressive pro-reunification and democratic forces in south Korea. If such anti-national and anti-reunification evil law is allowed to remain in force, it will be impossible any time to achieve the national reconciliation, unity and reunification and realize independence and democracy of the south Korean society.
					
					 The NSL, which brings sufferings to the south Korean people and does harm to the entire nation, should be abolished as it is an anachronistic evil law detrimental to the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 Attitude towards the abrogation of the NSL is a touchstone to distinguish the stand for national reconciliation, unity and reunification from the stand for north-south confrontation and fascist dictatorship.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group's persistent moves to swim against the trend of the June 15 era of reunification by dint of the NSL will more glaringly reveal its criminal nature as a group of maniacs seeking confrontation and fascist dictatorship. The group of traitors should discard its wild dream and abolish the ill-famed NSL without delay to meet the unanimous demand of the entire Korean nation.

articles.title: Japan's Move to Tighten Sanctions against DPRK under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Move to Tighten Sanctions against DPRK Blasted
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A resolution on extending again the embargo on the DPRK-flagged ships was adopted at the Japanese Diet recently under the pretext of the "abduction and nuclear issues." This was a deliberate and premeditated provocative act of the Japanese reactionaries to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK and stand in the way of solving the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the true intention of the Japanese reactionaries to drive the six-party talks to collapse and prevent the nuclear issue on the peninsula from being settled in a bid to secure a justification for the conversion of Japan into a military power and nuclear weaponization.
					
					  Japan is groundlessly finding fault with the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and frantically staging a campaign to suppress and destroy it by use of state power, hyping the abduction issue and persistently evading its responsibility for redressing its past crimes, the core issue in settling the issue of the relations between the DPRK and Japan. 
					
					 Japan has not yet honestly reflected on nor made any proper reparation for the hideous crimes it committed against humanity in the past. It has thrown documents on those crimes into fire for the past decades for fear of their disclosure. 
					
					 The crimes committed by Japan in the past can never fall into oblivion of themselves with the flow of time nor can they be written off due to its desperate efforts to cover them up. 
					
					 Japan's claim that it apologized for its hideous crimes committed against humanity in the past is nothing but hypocrisy intended to mislead world public opinion. 
					
					 It is the height of folly for the Japanese reactionaries to try to gain something by browbeating and pressurizing the Korean people through the racket of sanctions. 
					
					 They are expressing irrepressible resentment at the Japanese authorities keen to attain a sinister political aim by using the sanctions as a means of pressurizing the DPRK and hardening their will to settle accounts with Japan at any cost. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries' noisier call for tightened sanctions against the DPRK and the like will only invite bitterer disgrace and more thorough isolation in the international community.

articles.title: Japan's Missile Test-fire Blasted
articles.content:
Japan's Missile Test-fire Blasted
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries have recently test-fired "SM-3" aboard Aegis ship Choukai belonging to the Maritime "Self-Defense Force." This was the second of its kind since the first one conducted in the waters off Hawaii in December last year.
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 The moves frantically stepped up by the Japanese reactionaries to build a missile shield under the pretext of someone's "launch of ballistic missile" are aimed at neutralizing the DPRK's self-reliant war deterrent and putting their "strategy of preemptive attack" on the DPRK into practice at any cost. 
					
					 Huge aggressor forces of the U.S. and Japan are deployed in south Korea and in its vicinity and all of their war hardware is targeted on major objects and strongholds of strategic importance in the DPRK. Armistice has been preserved on the Korean Peninsula with difficulty despite such acute military confrontation thanks to the DPRK's powerful war deterrent. What the Japanese reactionaries seek is to upset the military equilibrium between the KPA side and its enemies on the peninsula. By steadily renewing and rounding off the anti-missile technology and system they seek to fully realize their scenario of "preemptive attack" on the DPRK by neutralizing its self-reliant war deterrent and thereby ensuring their military strategic edge and supremacy. 
					
					 Their military moves to stifle the DPRK by force of arms and reinvade Asia have reached a more serious phase. The army and people of the DPRK can never remain a passive onlooker to this development. 
					
					 The desperate efforts of the Japanese reactionaries to step up the policy of military confrontation towards the DPRK compel its army and people to take powerful and effective military and physical counter-measures to cope with it.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries will be held wholly accountable for all the ensuing consequences.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of Pomminryon Marked in Seoul
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of Pomminryon Marked in Seoul
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) held a meeting in Seoul on Nov. 30 to mark the 18th anniversary of its formation.
					 Present there were members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon and figures of different circles.
					
					 Ri Kyu Jae, chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, in a speech made at the meeting said that one's stand and attitude toward the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration is a touchstone showing whether one stands for reunification or for division.
					
					 Whoever denies these historical declarations for reunification can never escape bitter resentment and curse of the fellow countrymen, he warned.
					
					 He declared that the South Headquarters of Pomminryon would achieve the country's reunification without fail by focusing the actions on the anti-Lee Myung Bak struggle and fully implementing the above-said declarations under the uplifted banner of "By our nation itself."
					
					 Congratulatory messages from the North Headquarters, Overseas Headquarters and the Joint Secretariat of Pomminryon were introduced and a resolution was read out at the meeting.
					
					 The resolution noted that Pomminryon, regarding the idea of "By our nation itself" as its lifeline, is filled with the resolution to fulfill the mission it assumed before the times and the nation no matter how desperate the anti-reunification forces may become in their moves.

articles.title: Workers' Rally Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Workers' Rally Held in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- The Federation of south Korean Trade Unions held a workers' rally of south Korea in Seoul on November 29 in protest against the puppet authorities' moves to make a retrogressive revision of "the law on the part-time job" with at least 100,000 unionists affiliated to it attending.
					 The federation in a resolution adopted at the rally condemned the "government" and the management side for trying to make a retrogressive revision of the said law as evidenced by their moves to extend the period of hiring part-timers to four years from two years, etc.
					
					 It also accused them of working hard to enact an evil law aimed at suspending the payment of wages to union leaders and, at the same time, driving the workers' living to destitution through a unilateral restructuring. 
					
					  If the "government" is seeking to inflict pain upon the workers only under the pretext of economic crisis, they will meet the resistance of 16 million workers, the federation warned.
					
					 Holding that the unpopular labor policy should be totally rolled back, the federation demanded the authorities stop their moves to make a retrogressive revision of the said law and the restructuring. 
					
					 Earlier, the Confederation of Taxi Drivers' Unions and the Federation of Banking Workers Unions of south Korea separately held a meeting and a rally for the general advance of financial workers in denunciation of the moves of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors.

articles.title: Abrogation of NSL Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abrogation of NSL Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- A rally for putting an end to the disgraceful history of the "National Security Law" and building a new society free from this anti-national and anti-reunification fascist law took place in Seoul on November 30 on the lapse of six decades since the NSL was cooked up.
					 Attending the rally were members of civic and public organizations of different strata including the People's Solidarity for Abrogation of the "National Security Law", the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification, the south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions, the south Korean Council of Youth Organizations and the Bar Association for a Democratic Society.
					
					   Speakers at the rally denounced the Lee Myung Bak group for intensifying the fascist rule by dint of the NSL which has no need to remain in the June 15 era of reunification.
					
					 The Lee "government" invoking the NSL, an evil law for violation of human rights, has done such impudent deeds as cosponsoring "resolution on human rights issue in north Korea", finding fault with the DPRK, they charged.
					
					 Branding those insisting on the maintenance of the NSL as the forces seeking to keep their power under the pretext of "security", they contended that this evil law should be totally abrogated.
					
					 They also demanded immediate repeal of all other evil laws equivalent to the NSL such as a "bill on the revision of the law on Intelligence Service", a "bill for revising the law on protecting telecommunication secrets", the "law on combating terrorism", the "law on keeping secrets" and the "law on tiding over cyber crisis" submitted to the "National Assembly" by the "Grand National Party".
					
					 The participants in the rally urged the abrogation of the NSL, chanting slogans with candlelight in their hands.
					
					 Earlier, civic and public organizations of different strata held a seminar in Seoul on November 27, calling for more vigorous struggle to get the NSL abolished.

articles.title: GNP Accused of Blocking Settlement of Past
articles.content:
GNP Accused of Blocking Settlement of Past
 Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Permanent co-representatives of the All-People Committee for Proper Settlement of Past in south Korea on Nov. 21 issued a statement titled "Grand National Party, stop its attempt to dissolve and merge all the committees for settling the past history."
					 The statement recalled that the GNP gentries submitted to the "National Assembly" on Nov. 20 a "bill calling for dissolving and merging all the committees for settling the past history," the keynote of which is to transfer all the work of 14 committees for settling the past history including the committee for probing the truth behind mysterious deaths in the army to the "committee for settling the past history for truth and reconciliation."
					
					 It held that the GNP is citing "an insufficient budget and a measure to increase the work efficiency" as a pretext for such action but it is aimed to check the proper settlement of the crimes committed by the pro-Japanese remnants and fascist dictatorial regimes.
					
					 Demanding an immediate retraction of the above-said unreasonable "bill," the statement declared that all the people desirous of a thoroughgoing probe into the truth behind the past history and its proper settlement would stage an active struggle to check the GNP's moves.

articles.title: Japanese Police Authorities' Suppression Protested
articles.content:
Japanese Police Authorities' Suppression Protested
Pyongyang, December 2 (KCNA) -- Representatives of the Federation of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan, the Association of Young Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan and the Tokyo Metropolitan Association of Korean Workers in Commerce staged a protest against the police authorities' suppression in front of the Metropolitan Police Office of Japan on Nov. 28 
					 The representatives accused the Japanese police authorities of conducting a search operation against the offices of the Federation of Korean Workers in Commerce in Japan and the Tokyo Metropolitan Association of Korean Workers in Commerce in the Hall of Korean Workers in Commerce in Tokyo on Nov. 27.
					
					 They urged the Japanese authorities to stop the unwarranted suppression of the commercial organizations and guarantee the rights of the Koreans in Japan.
					
					 They met officials concerned of the Metropolitan Police Office to disclose the unreasonableness of the search operation and demanded it immediately return the confiscated things and apologize for it.
					
					 Meanwhile, officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan and Koreans in Japan staged actions in front of the Ueno Police Station on Nov. 27 and 28 condemning the police for arresting and detaining a young Korean on the charge of "interference in the performance of its duty" for the mere reason that he protested against its search operation and demanding his release.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il felicita a su homologo albanes
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il felicita a su homologo albanes
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, envio el 28 de noviembre un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo albanes Sali Berisha con motivo del dia nacional de este pais europeo.
					  La misiva desea al amistoso pueblo albanes el progreso y el bienestar.

articles.title: Convenio sobre amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Yemen
articles.content:
Convenio sobre amistad y cooperacion entre Corea y Yemen
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricado este martes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae el convenio sobre amistad y cooperacion entre el Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el Congreso Popular General de Yemen.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, y otros funcionarios y, por otra parte, los miembros de la delegacion de dicho congreso encabezado por Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim, miembro del Comite General y jefe del Departamento Politico.                  
					
					Kim Ki Nam y Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Proyeccion filmica por dia nacional de Rumania
articles.content:
Proyeccion filmica por dia nacional de Rumania
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este martes en el Club Taedonggang para el Cuerpo Diplomatico la proyeccion filmica por la Fiesta Nacional de Rumania.
					  En la ocasion estuvieron presentes la vicepresidenta del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Hong Son Ok, el vicepresidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rumania Ryu Sung Rim y otros funcionarios, trabajadores capitalinos, el encargado de negocios a. i. rumano en Corea Iancu Liviu Ovidiu y otros miembros de esta sede diplomatica.
					
					  Los participantes vieron una pelicula de ficcion rumana.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena la sancion anti-RPDC de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena la sancion anti-RPDC de Japon
Pyongyang, 2 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Recientemente, bajo el pretexto del supuesto "problema de secuestro y el nuclear" de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, la dieta japonesa aprobo la resolucion de prorrogar de nuevo la medida de prohibicion de la entrada a Japon de las embarcaciones coreanas.
					Esta provocacion premeditada de los reaccionarios japoneses se encamina a agravar el enfrentamiento con la RPDC e impedir la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					La intencion de ellos es llevar al fracaso las conversaciones a 6 bandas y frenar la solucion del problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana para procurar la justificacion de la conversion de su pais en una potencia militar y su armamentismo nuclear.
					
					Asi senala el rotativo Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este martes y continua:
					
					Al eludir obstinadamente el tema de liquidacion del pasado criminal, el fundamental en las relaciones Corea-Japon, cuestionando el problema de secuestro, este segundo lanzo usando hasta el poder estatal una frenetica campana para reprimir y exterminar a la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon) acusandola de cargos absurdos.
					
					Este pais isleno perpetro en el pasado tremendos crimenes antiteticos y todavia no se arrepiente sinceramente ni indemniza debidamente por el respecto. Al contrario, por el temor a la revelacion de sus fechorias, vino eliminado a quemadura durante varias decadas los documentos relativos a ellas.
					
					Pero, los crimenes de Japon no seran borrados ni silenciados aunque pase mucho tiempo y se hagan ingentes esfuerzos por ocultarlos.
					
					A fin de enganar a la opinion publica internacional, Japon miente que ya ha pedido disculpas por el particular.
					
					Es totalmente absurdo que los reaccionarios japoneses intentaran conseguir algo amedrentando y presionando al pueblo coreano con la campana de sancion. 
					
					A su vez, el pueblo coreano redobla su voluntad de ajustar la cuenta sin falta con ese pais isleno sintiendose sumamente indignado por la sucia conducta de las autoridades japonesas que persiguen sus malsanas metas politicas tomando la sancion por el medio de presion a la RPDC. 
					
					Si los reaccionarios japoneses siguen armando escandalos en busca de la sancion anti-RPDC, sera mas avergonzado y aislado en la sociedad internacional.
